memberdef.argsstring: (name s, name code, datastream< const char * > ds)
memberdef.name: system_contract

detaileddescription.para:
The Init action initializes the system contract for a version and a symbol. Only succeeds when:
version is 0 and
symbol is found and
system token supply is greater than 0,
and system contract wasnt already been initialized.

parameterdescription.para: - the version, has to be 0,
- the system symbol.

detaileddescription.para: On block action. This special action is triggered when a block is applied by the given producer and cannot be generated from any other source. It is used to pay producers and calculate missed blocks of other producers. Producer pay is deposited into the producer's stake balance and can be withdrawn over time. Once a minute, it may update the active producer config from the producer votes. The action also populates the blockinfo table.

parameterdescription.para: - the block header produced.

inbodydescription.para: until activation, no new rewards are paid
start the presses
At startup the initial producer may not be one that is registered / elected and therefore there may be no producer object for them.
only update block producers once every minute, block_timestamp is in half seconds

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &account, int64_t ram_bytes, int64_t net_weight, int64_t cpu_weight)
memberdef.name: setalimits

detaileddescription.para: Set account limits action sets the resource limits of an account

parameterdescription.para: - name of the account whose resource limit to be set,
- ram limit in absolute bytes,
- fractionally proportionate net limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts),
- fractionally proportionate cpu limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts).

detaileddescription.para: Set account RAM limits action, which sets the RAM limits of an account

parameterdescription.para: - name of the account whose resource limit to be set,
- ram limit in absolute bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Set account NET limits action, which sets the NET limits of an account

parameterdescription.para: - name of the account whose resource limit to be set,
- fractionally proportionate net limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts).

detaileddescription.para: Set account CPU limits action, which sets the CPU limits of an account

parameterdescription.para: - name of the account whose resource limit to be set,
- fractionally proportionate cpu limit of available resources based on (weight / total_weight_of_all_accounts).

detaileddescription.para: The activate action, activates a protocol feature

parameterdescription.para: - hash of the protocol feature to activate.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &receiver, const asset &stake_net_quantity, const asset &stake_cpu_quantity, bool transfer)
memberdef.name: delegatebw

detaileddescription.para: Delegate bandwidth and/or cpu action. Stakes SYS from the balance of from for the benefit of receiver.

parameterdescription.para: - the account to delegate bandwidth from, that is, the account holding tokens to be staked,
- the account to delegate bandwidth to, that is, the account to whose resources staked tokens are added
- tokens staked for NET bandwidth,
- tokens staked for CPU bandwidth,
- if true, ownership of staked tokens is transferred to receiver.

simplesect.para: All producers from account has voted for will have their votes updated immediately.

detaileddescription.para:
Setrex action, sets total_rent balance of REX pool to the passed value.
balance
- amount to set the REX pool balance.

Deposit to REX fund action. Deposits core tokens to user REX fund. All proceeds and expenses related to REX are added to or taken out of this fund. An inline transfer from 'owner' liquid balance is executed. All REX-related costs and proceeds are deducted from and added to 'owner' REX fund, with one exception being buying REX using staked tokens. Storage change is billed to 'owner'.

parameterdescription.para: - REX fund owner account,
- amount of tokens to be deposited.

detaileddescription.para: Withdraw from REX fund action, withdraws core tokens from user REX fund. An inline token transfer to user balance is executed.

parameterdescription.para: - REX fund owner account,
- amount of tokens to be withdrawn.

detaileddescription.para: Buyrex action, buys REX in exchange for tokens taken out of user's REX fund by transferring core tokens from user REX fund and converts them to REX stake. By buying REX, user is lending tokens in order to be rented as CPU or NET resources. Storage change is billed to 'from' account.

parameterdescription.para: - owner account name,
- amount of tokens taken out of 'from' REX fund.

simplesect.para: A voting requirement must be satisfied before action can be executed.
User must vote for at least 21 producers or delegate vote to proxy before buying REX.
User votes are updated following this action.
Tokens used in purchase are added to user's voting power.
Bought REX cannot be sold before 4 days counting from end of day of purchase.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &owner, const name &receiver, const asset &from_net, const asset &from_cpu)
memberdef.name: unstaketorex

detaileddescription.para: Unstaketorex action, uses staked core tokens to buy REX. Storage change is billed to 'owner' account.

parameterdescription.para: - owner of staked tokens,
- account name that tokens have previously been staked to,
- amount of tokens to be unstaked from NET bandwidth and used for REX purchase,
- amount of tokens to be unstaked from CPU bandwidth and used for REX purchase.

simplesect.para: A voting requirement must be satisfied before action can be executed.
User must vote for at least 21 producers or delegate vote to proxy before buying REX.
User votes are updated following this action.
Tokens used in purchase are added to user's voting power.
Bought REX cannot be sold before 4 days counting from end of day of purchase.

detaileddescription.para: Sellrex action, sells REX in exchange for core tokens by converting REX stake back into core tokens at current exchange rate. If order cannot be processed, it gets queued until there is enough in REX pool to fill order, and will be processed within 30 days at most. If successful, user votes are updated, that is, proceeds are deducted from user's voting power. In case sell order is queued, storage change is billed to 'from' account.

parameterdescription.para: - owner account of REX,
- amount of REX to be sold.

inbodydescription.para: REX order couldn't be filled and is added to queue. If account already has an open order, requested rex is added to existing order.

detaileddescription.para: Cnclrexorder action, cancels unfilled REX sell order by owner if one exists.

parameterdescription.para: - owner account name.

simplesect.para: Order cannot be cancelled once it's been filled.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &receiver, const asset &loan_payment, const asset &loan_fund)
memberdef.name: rentcpu

detaileddescription.para: Rentcpu action, uses payment to rent as many SYS tokens as possible as determined by market price and stake them for CPU for the benefit of receiver, after 30 days the rented core delegation of CPU will expire. At expiration, if balance is greater than or equal to loan_payment, loan_payment is taken out of loan balance and used to renew the loan. Otherwise, the loan is closed and user is refunded any remaining balance. Owner can fund or refund a loan at any time before its expiration. All loan expenses and refunds come out of or are added to owner's REX fund.

parameterdescription.para: - account creating and paying for CPU loan, 'from' account can add tokens to loan balance using action fundcpuloan and withdraw from loan balance using defcpuloan
- account receiving rented CPU resources,
- tokens paid for the loan, it has to be greater than zero, amount of rented resources is calculated from loan_payment,
- additional tokens can be zero, and is added to loan balance. Loan balance represents a reserve that is used at expiration for automatic loan renewal.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &receiver, const asset &loan_payment, const asset &loan_fund)
memberdef.name: rentnet

detaileddescription.para: Rentnet action, uses payment to rent as many SYS tokens as possible as determined by market price and stake them for NET for the benefit of receiver, after 30 days the rented core delegation of NET will expire. At expiration, if balance is greater than or equal to loan_payment, loan_payment is taken out of loan balance and used to renew the loan. Otherwise, the loan is closed and user is refunded any remaining balance. Owner can fund or refund a loan at any time before its expiration. All loan expenses and refunds come out of or are added to owner's REX fund.

parameterdescription.para: - account creating and paying for NET loan, 'from' account can add tokens to loan balance using action fundnetloan and withdraw from loan balance using defnetloan,
- account receiving rented NET resources,
- tokens paid for the loan, it has to be greater than zero, amount of rented resources is calculated from loan_payment,
- additional tokens can be zero, and is added to loan balance. Loan balance represents a reserve that is used at expiration for automatic loan renewal.

detaileddescription.para: Fundcpuloan action, transfers tokens from REX fund to the fund of a specific CPU loan in order to be used for loan renewal at expiry.

parameterdescription.para: - loan creator account,
- loan id,
- tokens transferred from REX fund to loan fund.

detaileddescription.para: Fundnetloan action, transfers tokens from REX fund to the fund of a specific NET loan in order to be used for loan renewal at expiry.

parameterdescription.para: - loan creator account,
- loan id,
- tokens transferred from REX fund to loan fund.

detaileddescription.para: Defcpuloan action, withdraws tokens from the fund of a specific CPU loan and adds them to REX fund.

parameterdescription.para: - loan creator account,
- loan id,
- tokens transferred from CPU loan fund to REX fund.

detaileddescription.para: Defnetloan action, withdraws tokens from the fund of a specific NET loan and adds them to REX fund.

parameterdescription.para: - loan creator account,
- loan id,
- tokens transferred from NET loan fund to REX fund.

detaileddescription.para: Updaterex action, updates REX owner vote weight to current value of held REX tokens.

parameterdescription.para: - REX owner account.

detaileddescription.para: Rexexec action, processes max CPU loans, max NET loans, and max queued sellrex orders. Action does not execute anything related to a specific user.

parameterdescription.para: - any account can execute this action,
- number of each of CPU loans, NET loans, and sell orders to be processed.

detaileddescription.para: Consolidate action, consolidates REX maturity buckets into one bucket that can be sold after 4 days starting from the end of the day.

parameterdescription.para: - REX owner account name.

detaileddescription.para: Mvtosavings action, moves a specified amount of REX into savings bucket. REX savings bucket never matures. In order for it to be sold, it has to be moved explicitly out of that bucket. Then the moved amount will have the regular maturity period of 4 days starting from the end of the day.

parameterdescription.para: - REX owner account name.
- amount of REX to be moved.

detaileddescription.para: Mvfrsavings action, moves a specified amount of REX out of savings bucket. The moved amount will have the regular REX maturity period of 4 days.

parameterdescription.para: - REX owner account name.
- amount of REX to be moved.

detaileddescription.para: Closerex action, deletes owner records from REX tables and frees used RAM. Owner must not have an outstanding REX balance.

parameterdescription.para: - user account name.

simplesect.para: If owner has a non-zero REX balance, the action fails; otherwise, owner REX balance entry is deleted.
If owner has no outstanding loans and a zero REX fund balance, REX fund entry is deleted.

inbodydescription.para: check for any outstanding loans or rex fund
check for remaining rex balance

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &receiver, const asset &unstake_net_quantity, const asset &unstake_cpu_quantity)
memberdef.name: undelegatebw

detaileddescription.para: Undelegate bandwidth action, decreases the total tokens delegated by from to receiver and/or frees the memory associated with the delegation if there is nothing left to delegate. This will cause an immediate reduction in net/cpu bandwidth of the receiver. A transaction is scheduled to send the tokens back to from after the staking period has passed. If existing transaction is scheduled, it will be canceled and a new transaction issued that has the combined undelegated amount. The from account loses voting power as a result of this call and all producer tallies are updated.

parameterdescription.para: - the account to undelegate bandwidth from, that is, the account whose tokens will be unstaked,
- the account to undelegate bandwidth to, that is, the account to whose benefit tokens have been staked,
- tokens to be unstaked from NET bandwidth,
- tokens to be unstaked from CPU bandwidth,

simplesect.para: Unstaked tokens are transferred to from liquid balance via a deferred transaction with a delay of 3 days.
If called during the delay period of a previous undelegatebw action, pending action is canceled and timer is reset.
All producers from account has voted for will have their votes updated immediately.
Bandwidth and storage for the deferred transaction are billed to from.

detaileddescription.para: Buy ram action, increases receiver's ram quota based upon current price and quantity of tokens provided. An inline transfer from receiver to system contract of tokens will be executed.

payer
- the ram buyer,
receiver
- the ram receiver,
quant
- the quantity of tokens to buy ram with.
When buying ram the payer irreversibly transfers quant to system contract and only the receiver may reclaim the tokens via the sellram action. The receiver pays for the storage of all database records associated with this action.
RAM is a scarce resource whose supply is defined by global properties max_ram_size. RAM is priced using the bancor algorithm such that price-per-byte with a constant reserve ratio of 100:1.
Buy a specific amount of ram bytes action. Increases receiver's ram in quantity of bytes provided. An inline transfer from receiver to system contract of tokens will be executed.

payer
- the ram buyer,
receiver
- the ram receiver,
bytes
- the quantity of ram to buy specified in bytes.
This action will buy an exact amount of ram and bill the payer the current market price.
Refund action, this action is called after the delegation-period to claim all pending unstaked tokens belonging to owner.

parameterdescription.para: - the owner of the tokens claimed.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &producer, const public_key &producer_key, const std::string &url, uint16_t location)
memberdef.name: regproducer

detaileddescription.para: Register producer action, indicates that a particular account wishes to become a producer, this action will create a producer_config and a producer_info object for producer scope in producers tables.

parameterdescription.para: - account registering to be a producer candidate,
- the public key of the block producer, this is the key used by block producer to sign blocks,
- the url of the block producer, normally the url of the block producer presentation website,
- is the country code as defined in the ISO 3166, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

simplesect.para: Producer to register is an account
Authority of producer to register

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &producer, const eosio::block_signing_authority &producer_authority, const std::string &url, uint16_t location)
memberdef.name: regproducer2

detaileddescription.para: Register producer action, indicates that a particular account wishes to become a producer, this action will create a producer_config and a producer_info object for producer scope in producers tables.

parameterdescription.para: - account registering to be a producer candidate,
- the weighted threshold multisig block signing authority of the block producer used to sign blocks,
- the url of the block producer, normally the url of the block producer presentation website,
- is the country code as defined in the ISO 3166, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes

simplesect.para: Producer to register is an account
Authority of producer to register

detaileddescription.para: Unregister producer action, deactivates the block producer with account name producer.

Deactivate the block producer with account name producer.
producer
- the block producer account to unregister.

Set ram action sets the ram supply.
max_ram_size
- the amount of ram supply to set.

inbodydescription.para: decreasing ram might result market maker issues
Increase the amount of ram for sale based upon the change in max ram size.

detaileddescription.para: Set ram rate action, sets the rate of increase of RAM in bytes per block. It is capped by the uint16_t to a maximum rate of 3 TB per year. If update_ram_supply hasn't been called for the most recent block, then new ram will be allocated at the old rate up to the present block before switching the rate.

parameterdescription.para: - the amount of bytes per block increase to set.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &voter, const name &proxy, const std::vector< name > &producers)
memberdef.name: voteproducer

detaileddescription.para: Vote producer action, votes for a set of producers. This action updates the list of producers voted for, for voter account. If voting for a proxy, the producer votes will not change until the proxy updates their own vote. Voter can vote for a proxy or a list of at most 30 producers. Storage change is billed to voter.

parameterdescription.para: - the account to change the voted producers for,
- the proxy to change the voted producers for,
- the list of producers to vote for, a maximum of 30 producers is allowed.

simplesect.para: Producers must be sorted from lowest to highest and must be registered and active
If proxy is set then no producers can be voted for
If proxy is set then proxy account must exist and be registered as a proxy
Every listed producer or proxy must have been previously registered
Voter must authorize this action
Voter must have previously staked some EOS for voting
Voter->staked must be up to date
Every producer previously voted for will have vote reduced by previous vote weight
Every producer newly voted for will have vote increased by new vote amount
Prior proxy will proxied_vote_weight decremented by previous vote weight
New proxy will proxied_vote_weight incremented by new vote weight

detaileddescription.para: Update the vote weight for the producers or proxy voter_name currently votes for. This will also update the staked value for the voter_name by checking rexbal and all delegated NET and CPU.

parameterdescription.para: - the account to update the votes for,

simplesect.para: the voter.staked will be updated
previously voted for producers vote weight will be updated with new weight
previously voted for proxy vote weight will be updated with new weight

detaileddescription.para: Register proxy action, sets proxy account as proxy. An account marked as a proxy can vote with the weight of other accounts which have selected it as a proxy. Other accounts must refresh their voteproducer to update the proxy's weight. Storage change is billed to proxy.

parameterdescription.para: - the account registering as voter proxy (or unregistering),
- if true, proxy is registered; if false, proxy is unregistered.

simplesect.para: Proxy must have something staked (existing row in voters table)
New state must be different than current state

detaileddescription.para:
Set the blockchain parameters. By tunning these parameters a degree of customization can be achieved.
params
- New blockchain parameters to set.

Claim rewards action, claims block producing and vote rewards.
owner
- producer account claiming per-block and per-vote rewards.

inbodydescription.para: New metric to be used in pervote pay calculation. Instead of vote weight ratio, we combine vote weight and time duration the vote weight has been held into one metric.

detaileddescription.para:
Set privilege status for an account. Allows to set privilege status for an account (turn it on/off).
account
- the account to set the privileged status for.
is_priv
- 0 for false, > 0 for true.

Remove producer action, deactivates a producer by name, if not found asserts.
producer
- the producer account to deactivate.

Update revision action, updates the current revision.
revision
- it has to be incremented by 1 compared with current revision.
Current revision can not be higher than 254, and has to be smaller than or equal 1 (set upper bound to greatest revision supported in the code).

Bid name action, allows an account bidder to place a bid for a name newname.
bidder
- the account placing the bid,
newname
- the name the bid is placed for,
bid
- the amount of system tokens payed for the bid.
Bids can be placed only on top-level suffix,
Non empty name,
Names longer than 12 chars are not allowed,
Names equal with 12 chars can be created without placing a bid,
Bid has to be bigger than zero,
Bid's symbol must be system token,
Bidder account has to be different than current highest bidder,
Bid must increase current bid by 10%,
Auction must still be opened.
Bid refund action, allows the account bidder to get back the amount it bid so far on a newname name.

parameterdescription.para: - the account that gets refunded,
- the name for which the bid was placed and now it gets refunded for.

detaileddescription.para: Change the annual inflation rate of the core token supply and specify how the new issued tokens will be distributed based on the following structure.

parameterdescription.para: - Annual inflation rate of the core token supply. (eg. For 5% Annual inflation => annual_rate=500 For 1.5% Annual inflation => annual_rate=150

- Inverse of the fraction of the inflation used to reward block producers. The remaining inflation will be sent to the eosio.saving account. (eg. For 20% of inflation going to block producer rewards => inflation_pay_factor = 50000 For 100% of inflation going to block producer rewards => inflation_pay_factor = 10000).

- Inverse of the fraction of the block producer rewards to be distributed proportional to blocks produced. The remaining rewards will be distributed proportional to votes received. (eg. For 25% of block producer rewards going towards block pay => votepay_factor = 40000 For 75% of block producer rewards going towards block pay => votepay_factor = 13333).

detaileddescription.para: Configure the power market. The market becomes available the first time this action is invoked.
Process power queue and update state. Action does not execute anything related to a specific user.

parameterdescription.para: - any account can execute this action
- number of queue items to process

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &payer, const name &receiver, uint32_t days, const asset &payment, const bool transfer=false)
memberdef.name: powerup

detaileddescription.para: Powerup NET and CPU resources by percentage

parameterdescription.para: - the resource buyer
- the resource receiver
- number of days of resource availability. Must match market configuration.
- fraction of net (100% = 10^15) managed by this market
- fraction of cpu (100% = 10^15) managed by this market
- the maximum amount payer is willing to pay. Tokens are withdrawn from payer's token balance.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &account, const std::vector< name > &allow_perms, const std::vector< name > &disallow_perms)
memberdef.name: limitauthchg

detaileddescription.para: limitauthchg opts into or out of restrictions on updateauth, deleteauth, linkauth, and unlinkauth.

If either allow_perms or disallow_perms is non-empty, then opts into restrictions. If allow_perms is non-empty, then the authorized_by argument of the restricted actions must be in the vector, or the actions will abort. If disallow_perms is non-empty, then the authorized_by argument of the restricted actions must not be in the vector, or the actions will abort.
If both allow_perms and disallow_perms are empty, then opts out of the restrictions. limitauthchg aborts if both allow_perms and disallow_perms are non-empty.

parameterdescription.para: - account to change
- permissions which may use the restricted actions
- permissions which may not use the restricted actions

briefdescription.para: Calculates maturity time of purchased REX tokens which is 4 days from end of the day UTC.

simplesect.para: time_point_sec

inbodydescription.para: Increase the amount of ram for sale based upon the change in max ram size.

briefdescription.para: Performs maintenance operations on expired NET and CPU loans and sellrex orders.

parameterdescription.para: - maximum number of each of the three categories to be processed

inbodydescription.para: update rex_pool in order to delete existing loan
calculate rented tokens at current price
conditions for loan renewal
loan has sufficient balance
loan has favorable return
no pending sell orders
update rex_pool in order to account for renewed loan
update renewed loan fields
refund "from" account if the closed loan balance is positive
transfer from eosio.names to eosio.rex
process cpu loans
process net loans
process sellrex orders
send dummy action to show owner and proceeds of filled sellrex order

briefdescription.para: Adds returns from the REX return pool to the REX pool.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &receiver, int64_t delta_net, int64_t delta_cpu)
memberdef.name: update_resource_limits

briefdescription.para: Updates account NET and CPU resource limits.

parameterdescription.para: - account charged for RAM if there is a need
- account whose resource limits are updated
- change in NET bandwidth limit
- change in CPU bandwidth limit

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &owner, const char *error_msg="must vote for at least 21 producers or for a proxy before buying REX") const
memberdef.name: check_voting_requirement

param.defval: "must vote for at least 21 producers or for a proxy before buying REX"

briefdescription.para: Checks if account satisfies voting requirement (voting for a proxy or 21 producers) for buying REX.

parameterdescription.para: - account buying or already holding REX tokens @err_msg - error message

briefdescription.para: Processes a sellrex order and returns object containing the results.

detaileddescription.para: Processes an incoming or already scheduled sellrex order. If REX pool has enough core tokens not frozen in loans, order is filled. In this case, REX pool totals, user rex_balance and user vote_stake are updated. However, this function does not update user voting power. The function returns success flag, order proceeds, and vote stake delta. These are used later in a different function to complete order processing, i.e. transfer proceeds to user REX fund and update user vote weight.

parameterdescription.para: - iterator pointing to rex_balance database record
- amount of rex to be sold

simplesect.para: rex_order_outcome - a struct containing success flag, order proceeds, and resultant vote stake change

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &owner, const asset &proceeds, const asset &unstake_quant, bool force_vote_update=false)
memberdef.name: update_rex_account

briefdescription.para: Processes owner filled sellrex order and updates vote weight.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if user has a scheduled sellrex order that has been filled, completes its processing, and deletes it. Processing entails transferring proceeds to user REX fund and updating user vote weight. Additional proceeds and stake change can be passed as arguments. This function is called only by actions pushed by owner.

parameterdescription.para: - owner account name
- additional proceeds to be transferred to owner REX fund
- additional stake to be added to owner vote weight
- if true, vote weight is updated even if vote stake didn't change

simplesect.para: asset - REX amount of owner unfilled sell order if one exists

briefdescription.para: Channels system fees to REX pool.

parameterdescription.para: - account from which asset is transferred to REX pool
- amount of tokens to be transferred
- if true, asserts when the system is not configured to channel fees into REX

briefdescription.para: Updates namebid proceeds to be transferred to REX pool.

parameterdescription.para: - highest bidding amount of closed namebid

memberdef.argsstring: (T &table, const name &from, const name &receiver, const asset &loan_payment, const asset &loan_fund)
memberdef.name: rent_rex

inbodydescription.para: already checked that _rexpool.begin() != _rexpool.end() in rex_loans_available()

memberdef.argsstring: (T &table, const name &from, uint64_t loan_num, const asset &payment)
memberdef.name: fund_rex_loan

memberdef.argsstring: (T &table, const name &from, uint64_t loan_num, const asset &amount)
memberdef.name: defund_rex_loan

briefdescription.para: Transfers tokens from owner REX fund.

simplesect.para: - owner REX fund has sufficient balance

parameterdescription.para: - owner account name
- tokens to be transferred out of REX fund

briefdescription.para: Transfers tokens to owner REX fund.

parameterdescription.para: - owner account name
- tokens to be transferred to REX fund

briefdescription.para: Checks if CPU and Network loans are available.

detaileddescription.para: Loans are available if 1) REX pool lendable balance is nonempty, and 2) there are no unfilled sellrex orders.

briefdescription.para: Updates owner REX balance upon buying REX tokens.

parameterdescription.para: - account name of REX owner
- amount core tokens paid to buy REX
- amount of purchased REX tokens

simplesect.para: asset - change in owner REX vote stake

briefdescription.para: Updates REX pool balances upon REX purchase.

parameterdescription.para: - amount of core tokens paid

simplesect.para: asset - calculated amount of REX tokens purchased

inbodydescription.para: If CORE_SYMBOL is (EOS,4), maximum supply is 10^10 tokens (10 billion tokens), i.e., maximum amount of indivisible units is 10^14. rex_ratio = 10^4 sets the upper bound on (REX,4) indivisible units to 10^18 and that is within the maximum allowable amount field of asset type which is set to 2^62 (approximately 4.6 * 10^18). For a different CORE_SYMBOL, and in order for maximum (REX,4) amount not to exceed that limit, maximum amount of indivisible units cannot be set to a value larger than 4 * 10^14. If precision of CORE_SYMBOL is 4, that corresponds to a maximum supply of 40 billion tokens.
base balance prevents renting profitably until at least a minimum number of core_symbol() is made available
initialize REX pool
should be a rare corner case, REX pool is initialized but empty
total_lendable > 0 if total_rex > 0 except in a rare case and due to rounding errors

briefdescription.para: Adds an amount of core tokens to the REX return pool.

parameterdescription.para: - amount to be added

briefdescription.para: Updates REX owner maturity buckets.

parameterdescription.para: - iterator pointing to rex_balance object

briefdescription.para: Consolidates REX maturity buckets into one.

parameterdescription.para: - iterator pointing to rex_balance object
- REX tokens in owner unfilled sell order, if one exists

briefdescription.para: Reads amount of REX in savings bucket and removes the bucket from maturities.

detaileddescription.para: Reads and (temporarily) removes REX savings bucket from REX maturities in order to allow uniform processing of remaining buckets as savings is a special case. This function is used in conjunction with put_rex_savings.

parameterdescription.para: - iterator pointing to rex_balance object

simplesect.para: int64_t - amount of REX in savings bucket

briefdescription.para: Adds a specified REX amount to savings bucket.

parameterdescription.para: - iterator pointing to rex_balance object
- amount of REX to be added

briefdescription.para: Updates voter REX vote stake to the current value of REX tokens held.

parameterdescription.para: - account name of voter

briefdescription.para: Updates rex_pool balances upon creating a new loan or renewing an existing one.

inbodydescription.para: staking creates voter object

The first time someone votes we calculate and set last_vote_weight. Since they cannot unstake until after the chain has been activated, we can use last_vote_weight to determine that this is their first vote and should consider their stake activated.
don't propagate small changes (1 ~= epsilon)

detaileddescription.para: The eosio.system smart contract is provided by block.one as a sample system contract, and it defines the structures and actions needed for blockchain's core functionality.

Just like in the eosio.bios sample contract implementation, there are a few actions which are not implemented at the contract level (newaccount, updateauth, deleteauth, linkauth, unlinkauth, canceldelay, onerror, setabi, setcode), they are just declared in the contract so they will show in the contract's ABI and users will be able to push those actions to the chain via the account holding the eosio.system contract, but the implementation is at the EOSIO core level. They are referred to as EOSIO native actions.

listitem.para: Users can stake tokens for CPU and Network bandwidth, and then vote for producers or delegate their vote to a proxy.
Producers register in order to be voted for, and can claim per-block and per-vote rewards.
Users can buy and sell RAM at a market-determined price.
Users can bid on premium names.
A resource exchange system (REX) allows token holders to lend their tokens, and users to rent CPU and Network resources in return for a market-determined fee.
A resource market separate from REX: power.
